instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" Touch Bar 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi,
I'm trying to fix that board that obviously had a WD, when I plug the charger I can hear the charger sound notification like for an Iphone.
I checked PPBUS and I have 12.59V. But on the other hand it doesn't pull any current when I check my little usb power meter: 20.3V  0A
The thing as this board is relatively new, I don't have yet the brd and schematics files to correctly diagnose it.
I will attempt to clean it.
Question what would be the closer board regarding the schematics to be able to work on it.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" Touch Bar 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: I think this chip has fried as well it's assiociate capacitor......  some one could help me to tell me what's for? and which power rails is/are involved in this aera?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" Touch Bar 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full" width="30%"]44103._xfImport[/ATTACH]
After cleaning the different corroded area here what are the mesurement I have......and apparently it goes in S5 state and maybe even more when you see the values......
It also looks like that the cpu is getting hot......
Some knows where I can catch the CPU Vcore rail?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" Touch Bar 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Once the motherboard replaced in the mbp chassis and everything plugged back, PPBUS is 12.98V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" Touch Bar 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message: Was here liquid near the CPU? (Chips above CPU). If so, dead CPU more than likely.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 13" Touch Bar 2018 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>
threads.message:
The biggest coils near CPU, are for VCORE and iGPU.
CPU dies too easy on the new machines; not by itself, but liquid spill kills it almost al the time.
